results.title: Cold can kill
results.brief_description: Presents the dangers of hypothermia and demonstrates preventive measures. Covers hypothermia caused by immersion in cold water and exposure to wind and low temperatures.

results.title: Cold-rodders
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Marc Beaudet and Claude Larue
results.brief_description: An amusing view of the machine that has taken the country by winter storm: the snowmobile, revving, raring, ready to go. What the motorboat was to the summer lake, this motorized sled now is to the snow-covered fields. This film shows it all - the pull of this sit-down sport, the eagerness of the trade to keep it booming, the daring rivalry of the racing crowd, and the bemused pleasure of the family outing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Marc Beaudet and Claude Larue

results.title: Coke Bottle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Design Classic Series”.
Drink a bottle of Coke and you participate in the American dream. The words of Stephen Bayly, Director of the Conran Foundation epitomise the global system of Western Capitalism. Alex Samuelson’s bottle design won a competition held by the Coca Cola company in 1915.

results.title: Cognitive processes
results.creator_credit: WGBH (Boston), Tuggelin Yourgrau and David Espar
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
Why have people always been able to link different elements and ideas into coherent relationships? It is our thoughts, our cognitive processes, that give meaning to everything. In this program, Philip Zimbardo examines the work of cognitive psychologists who study how people take in information, store it, transmit it and manipulate it, that is, exploring how we think and solve problems.

results.title: Cognitive development (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: CRM Educational Films and Peter Jordan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Describes and portrays two major theories of cognitive development: Jean Piaget’s developmental stage approach with its emphasis on environmental and maturational factors; and the cognitive, learning or behavioural approach of Jerome Bruner, Jerome Kagan and Sidney Bijou. Also examines Dr Siegfried Engelmann’s behaviorist view of intellectual development. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.

Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.

Also examines Dr Siegfried Engelmann’s behaviorist view of intellectual development. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.

results.title: Cognitive development
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Psychology Live”.
This program looks at theories of cognitive development over time from the theories of Jean Piaget to those of Jerome Bruner and assesses their contribution to both past and present research into cognitive development and to educational practices. Although tailored to year 12 and tertiary Psychology students, the program’s information is of general interest and contains several practical exercises, real life demonstrations and self-tests. The presenters support the “ecological approach” of cognitive psychology, which values the research done in situations of everyday life, not just in laboratories. This program focuses on introducing the theories of Jean Piaget, his notion of schema, assimilation, accommodation, and equilibration as well as his theory of the stages in cognitive development. His methodology is then explored in detail along with a discussion of recent research findings which disagree with his. Jerome Bruner’s theory and modes of representing the world is then introduced, compared with Piaget’s theories, particulary in relation to the role of language in cognitive development, and included in a discussion of the future of the study of cognitive development in relation to recent research in metacognition and the theory of the mind. Study notes included.

results.title: Cognitive development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Describes and portrays two major theories of cognitive development: Jean Piaget’s developmental stage approach with its emphasis on maturational and environmental factors; and the cognitive learning or cognitive behavioural approach subscribed to by such developmentalists as Jerome Bruner, Jerome Kagan and Sidney Bijou. Suitable for tertiary and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Cognitive development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
Cognition involves the acquiring and use of knowledge. From birth, infants must learn how to learn and develop their senses, memory and perception. This episode discusses the stages of cognitive development as well as examining the theories of Piaget, the roles of recognition and receptive memory and the effect of stimulation in developing cognitive skills.
